direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve removing elements from the list, but 'removeIf' uses a predicate for conditional removal.
Both methods remove elements from the list, but 'removeAll' removes based on a collection of elements, while 'removeIf' uses a predicate.
Both methods modify the list by removing elements, but 'retainAll' retains only the elements present in the provided collection, while 'removeIf' removes based on a predicate.
Both methods modify the list by removing elements, but 'clear' removes all elements, while 'removeIf' removes based on a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the list and updating the internal set to maintain uniqueness, but 'set' modifies a specific index, while 'removeIf' removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the list and updating the internal set to maintain uniqueness, but 'add' inserts elements, while 'removeIf' removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve modifying the list and updating the internal set to maintain uniqueness, but 'addAll' inserts elements from a collection, while 'removeIf' removes elements based on a predicate.
Both methods involve creating a subset of the list, but 'subList' creates a view of a portion of the list, while 'removeIf' modifies the list by removing elements based on a predicate.
